business.headline: Sensex closes over 500 points, Nifty above 23,300; NTPC gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 557.45 points to end at 76,905.51, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 159.75 points to close at 23,350.40.

Government to lapse $23 billion scheme to boost domestic manufacturing: ReportThe Production-Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme, introduced in 2020, aimed to increase manufacturing's share of India's economy to 25% by 2025.

SBI Card Flexipay: Know how to convert credit card payments into EMIsOne can convert transactions of Rs 500 or more into EMIs under SBI Card's Flexipay option. It offers multiple repayment tenure options, such as three, six, nine, 12, 18 and 24 months.

Smallcap, midcap stocks gain momentum. Good news for mutual funds too?Given the correction, some analysts have indicated that quality smallcap and midcap stocks could start regaining some momentum. But does this apply to smallcap and midcap mutual funds too?

Rupee heads for best week in 2 years as dollar inflows riseAt 1 pm, the rupee was trading at 86.07 against the US dollar, extending its weekly gain to 0.72%. This marks the strongest weekly performance for the rupee since 2022.

Is the foreign selling crisis finally over on Dalal Street?Foreign investors turned net buyers in two of the last four sessions, sparking a market rally. While selling pressure has eased, is the months-long foreign outflow crisis finally coming to an end?

Morgan Stanley to layoff 2,000 employees to boost efficiencySeveral renowned banks have been reducing their workforce recently as they brace for economic uncertainty following President Donald Trump's newly announced trade tariffs.

Tata Group quietly becomes Tesla's global supplier: ReportTata firms have already signed global agreements with Tesla and are supplying various parts and services and their involvement is expected to grow further.

Unified Pension Scheme: Who can join and how much to contributeUPS will be available to central government employees who meet specific criteria. This includes existing employees under NPS as of 1st April 2025. It also includes newly recruited employees joining central government services on or after April 1, 2025.
Can AI pick winning stocks on Dalal Street? Check out these toolsOne of the major advantages of using AI is that it takes care of the labour-intensive aspects of trading efficiently, as per experts.

Pakistan plans to legalise cryptocurrency to tackle economic slowdownNearly 15-20 million Pakistanis are already trading digital assets. Further, countries like the US and UAE are embracing crypto-friendly policies, making it crucial for Pakistan to stay competitive.

Sensex climbs over 600 points. Check key reasons behind stock market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 604.77 points to trade at 76,952.83 at 12:37 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 175.35 points to 23,366. Adding to the cheer was the continued rally in smallcap and midcap segments.

Bajaj Finance shares rally over 3% to reach record high, analysts bullishShares of the non-banking financial company rose 3.5% in early trade to reach a day's high of 9,070. At around 10:35 am, shares of the company were trading 2.43% higher at Rs 8,891.15 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
RVNL shares rise 4% as railway PSU bags Rs 555 crore project. Check detailsThe shares of RVNL were trading 4.18% higher at Rs 373 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

This woman earned $350 million a day but lost $3.6 billion in 3 daysMarina Bumdiman had accumulated a fortune of $7.5 billion, making her the richest woman in Indonesia. However, the rapid rise was followed by an equally sharp fall. In just three days, her net worth was cut in half, wiping out $3.6 billion.

Ola Electric shares jump over 6% after clarification on February sales dataOla Electric Mobility's share price rose over 6% on the Bombay Stock Exchange in early trade after an important clarification.

Accenture revenue forecast hits IT stocks, Infosys, Wipro fallAccenture, which is seen as a key indicator for the Indian IT sector, raised the lower end of its annual revenue forecast but kept the upper end unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks drag markets down after 4-day rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 98.30 points to 76,249.76, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 21.85 points to 23,168.80 as of 9:25 am.

Ola Electric explains February sales mismatch: Temporary backlog in registrationsOla Electric addressed concerns about the mismatch in a stock exchange filing, saying that daily registrations have now exceeded 50% of its three-month daily sales average.

Sensex, Nifty opening predictions on March 21: What to expect todayBSE, NSE today: Nifty has posted gains for four straight sessions this week, marking its longest winning streak in nearly seven weeks.

Stocks to watch on March 21: TCS, HUL, Zomato, Adani Enterprises, Jio FinancialSeveral stocks will be in focus today due to recent developments. These include Hindustan Unilever (HUL), Jio Financial, Adani Enterprises, Infosys, TCS, Bajaj Finance, Zomato, and others.

Planning taxes for FY2026? Which regime to pick- old or new?The old tax regime offers over 70 deductions and exemptions, including HRA, LTA, Section 80C, 80D, home loan interest, and education loan interest. Meanwhile, the new tax regime has simplified slabs but does not offer these deductions.

US stock market opening: Wall Street opens lower as tariff concerns resurfaceDarden Restaurants Inc. was the biggest gainer, climbing by 6.52%, at the opening bell. Others in the green zone included Jabil Inc., up by 4.09%, Solventum Corp., which rose by 2.41% and TransDigm Group Inc., which climbed by 2.15%.

EPFO speeds up claim processing, 60% settled via automated systemTo further quicken the process, EPFO has automated claims related to medical emergencies, housing, studies, and marriage costs. With this system in place, claims are now processed within just three days.

Daughter's future? Which is better- Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana or ELSS?SSY offers 8.2% as an annual interest rate. Investors can invest a minimum of Rs 250, while the maximum limit is Rs 1.5 lakh per year. Further, this scheme allows tax benefits under Sector 80C of the Income Tax Act 1961.

Money after divorce: How courts calculate alimonyAlimony in India does not follow a fixed formula. Courts consider various factors such as the financial position of both spouses, their earning potential, and their contributions to the marriage.

Jio Financial, Allianz likely reach deal for insurance joint venture in India: ReportJio Financial Services has reached an initial deal for a joint venture with Allianz SE to form an insurance business in India.
Sensex ends 900 points higher, Nifty over 23,100; Airtel gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 899.01 points to close at 76,348.06, while the NSE Nifty50 added 283.05 points to end at 23,190.65.

Worker regrets moving from Noida to Bengaluru for Rs 30,000 hike. Here's whyIn a recent social media post, a corporate employee described Bengaluru as "dirty, unorganised," with bad roads and the worst traffic. Apart from infrastructure issues, the worker also mentioned feeling a "north vs south" divide in everyday interactions.

Air India in talks to buy more widebody jets from Airbus and Boeing: ReportThe potential order is expected to be worth billions of dollars and could help the airline expand its long-haul fleet as it undergoes a major transformation under Tata Group ownership.

Sensex soars over 900 points: 3 factors behind stock market rallyShare market today: This week has been one of the best for Dalal Street this year. The S&P BSE Sensex surged 818.21 points to 76,267.26, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 254.50 points to 23,162.10 at 1:33 pm.

Boeing plane delays clip Akasa Air's wings, pilots left waiting: ReportAkasa is among many global airlines affected by Boeing's production issues, which have been worsened by regulatory scrutiny and a workers' strike.

Nithin Kamath's advice to investors amid market volatility : 'Cut your losers'Zerodha's Nithin Kamath shared an essential trading rule that is knowing when to exit a bad trade. Kamath explained that traders often hold on to losing positions, hoping they will recover. But instead of hoping, traders should act with caution and cut their losses early.

IndiGo shares soar after recent update, hit record high. Buy, sell or hold?In just 5 trading sessions, the stock has soared roughly 8%. IndiGo's stock is up over 10% this year and nearly 13% in a month. The latest jump in its share price came after the company recently shared its roadmap for FY30.

Adani group in $1.4 billion deal talks to buy Emaar's India business: ReportEmaar India has a strong presence in residential and commercial real estate across multiple states, including New Delhi, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan.

Government simplifies compounding rules, relaxes process for tax defaultersThe move aims to provide relief to taxpayers, to settle matters smoothly with the tax authorities and reduce unnecessary litigation.

Exiting foreign investors hurt Dalal Street rally, especially IT stocksContinued selling by foreign portfolio investors (FPIs), which persisted in the first half of March, could hurt market sentiment. FPIs mostly sold information technology (IT) and consumer goods stocks, with lingering concerns over the US and Indian economies.

Will US Fed's rate pause derail RBI's liquidity easing plans?With the US Fed on hold, will RBI ease further? After cutting the repo rate to 6.25% last month, the first in nearly five years, markets are watching for the central bank's next move.
Infosys, TCS, HCLTech gain up to 2%: Why are IT stocks rising today?IT sector stocks showcased strong performance in early trade with the Nifty IT index surging 1.56% as of 10 am.

TVS Motor shares rise as board to consider interim dividend today. Check detailsTVS Motor shares were trading marginally higher in early trade as investors await today's board meeting to consider an interim dividend for FY25.

entertainment.headline: Snow White review: Gal Gadot is the bright spot in an otherwise dull narrativeReleased-Fri Mar 21, 2025The 2025 live-action adaptation of Snow White, starring Rachel Zegler and directed by Marc Webb, fails to capture the magic of the original 1937 classic. Despite Gal Gadot's standout performance as the Evil Queen and impressive visuals, the film lacks emotional depth and leaves little impact.

Did Apoorva Mukhija create trouble, yell at Sabrina Carpenter's Paris concert?Social media influencer Apoorva Mukhija, known as The Rebel Kid, allegedly caused a disruption at Sabrina Carpenter's concert. Video of her from the concert is going viral.
Akshay Kumar drops hint about Kesari Chapter 2 in film's 6th anniversary postAkshay Kumar shared a post and hinted at the Kesari sequel. The actor celebrated six years of the historical drama.

Aamir Khan and Ashutosh Gowariker 'had big fights' over Lagaan's logicAamir Khan revealed he argued with Lagaan director Ashutosh Gowariker over his character's clean-shaven look in a water-scarce village. The filmmaker, however, asked him to ignore logic.

Rani Mukerji redefines badassery as 'Mardaani', and what to expect from part 3Rani Mukerji's role in 'Mardaani' channels the anger and angst of a nation as a super cop Shivani Shivaji Roy while dealing with crimes against women. On her 47th birthday today, let us take a look at how her fierce character in the film just made it more relevant.

John Abraham on classmate Hrithik Roshan: He was good at breakdancing even in schoolJohn Abraham shared that he and Hrithik Roshan were classmates in Bombay Scottish School. He also revealed that Roshan was an exceptional dancer even in school.

Chhaava: Mumbai police register case over online piracy of Vicky Kaushal filmFollowing a complaint from August Entertainment Pvt Ltd, Mumbai Police have registered a case against the illegal distribution of the film Chhaava.

John Abraham reveals OTT platforms rejected The Diplomat: They threw it outJohn Abraham revealed that several OTT platforms rejected The Diplomat, but its unexpected success proved them wrong. The film, based on real events, has earned over Rs 19 crore since its release.

Jay-Z, Beyonce consider legal action against Kanye West as he targets their twinsJay-Z and Beyonce are reportedly exploring legal options against Kanye West. This follows a controversial post by West regarding their children.

BTS' J-hope releases Mona Lisa music video, a playful single that's Hobie coded J-hope of BTS launched a new music video, Mona Lisa, which has funky beats and dynamic dance moves. It's a visual feast.

Dhanashree's song on infidelity, domestic abuse post divorce from Yuzvendra ChahalChoregrapher Dhanashree Verma released a new song titled 'Dekha Ji Dekha Maine' on the same day she was granted a divorce from cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal.

Ranbir Kapoor talks about his 'first wife'. No, it isn't Alia BhattRanbir Kapoor shared a bizarre fan story, revealing that a girl once arrived with a Pandit at his bungalow to get married to him. He later joked about meeting his 'first wife.'

Sonakshi Sinha on life with Zaheer Iqbal: Haven't wasted a day since I met himSonakshi Sinha shared a heart-warming 'husband appreciation post' for Zaheer Iqbal, calling him her source of laughter. The couple got married in June 2024.

Mahesh Babu's son Gautam performs mime at New York college, excited fans reactActor Mahesh Babu's son is studying dramatics at New York University. In a video shared by a fan-club, he is seen performing a mime with a girl. The video has now gone viral on social media.

Naga Chaitanya ribs wife Sobhita Dhulipala: You lack basic human skillsSobhita Dhulipala and Naga Chaitanya shared fun relationship insights, from who apologises first to who is more dramatic when sick. The couple got married in December 2024 in a traditional ceremony.

Mohanlal's Empuraan scripts history in pre-sales, set for a grand openingMohanlal's L2: Empuraan is taking the box office by storm in its pre-sales. According to initial reports, the film has grossed over Rs 12 crore only in the international market.

One Battle After Another teaser: Leonardo DiCaprio brings grit, gunfire in actionerThe teaser trailer of Paul Thomas Anderson's upcoming film with Leonardo DiCaprio was released. Titled One Battle After Another, the action-thriller is set for a September 2025 release.

Aamir Khan's family 'happy' about his relationship with Gauri, says sister NikhatAamir Khan's sister, Nikhat Hegde, said she is happy with his relationship with Gauri Spratt. She also praised Gauri and wished for the couple to stay happy forever.

Kanneda review: Parmish Varma is fantastic in gangster drama beyond guns and goons Released-Fri Mar 21, 2025'Kanneda' is a breath of fresh air in the Indian OTT scene. Singer and actor Parmish Verma bowls you over as an underdog-turned-drug-lord in the 90s 'Kanneda' of the Punjabi immigrants.

general news.headline: Supreme Court begins probe after cash found at Delhi High Court judge's homeThe Supreme Court has initiated a probe into allegations against a Delhi High Court judge after a significant amount of cash was recovered from his official residence following a fire incident.

Meerut murder mystery deepens: Black magic, Bollywood dream, money transferPolice said that after the former Navy officer was killed and his body chopped up, Muskan's lover took Saurabh's head and hands to his room and performed black magic.

Disha Salian's father's lawyer claims eyewitnesses against Aaditya ThackerayAdvocate Nilesh Ojha said he had full trust in Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, but not in the Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing Disha Salian's death.

Why Shivaji's grandson went on pilgrimage to Aurangzeb's tombShahu I, the grandson of Shivaji and son of Shambhaji who was executed by the Mughals, visited Aurangzeb's grave. The visit by Shahuji, who was kept captive for 18 years in a Mughal camp, has to be seen in the correct historical and political context, and his battle with Maratha queen Tarabai Bhosle.

Elon Musk to be briefed on secret plan for potential war with China? Trump reactsAccording to the New York Times report, the briefing would include 20 to 30 slides that lay out how the United States would fight in a conflict with China.

Stalin is fiddling as Tamil Nadu is strugglingThe MK Stalin-led DMK, in its electoral promise, assured the state of Tamil Nadu that it would ease its debt burden. However, despite bringing together a few economists in pursuit of this goal, the state's debt burden has doubled in just four years.

Wrong judgment: Minister slams High Court's 'grabbing breasts isn't rape' rulingThe minister's reaction came after a bench of Justice Ram Manohar Narayan Mishra modified an earlier trial court order that had summoned two men under Section 376 (rape) of the Indian Penal Code and Section 18 (attempt to commit an offence) of the Prevention of Children from Sexual Offences (Pocso) Act.

Dhanashree's song on infidelity, domestic abuse post divorce from Yuzvendra ChahalChoregrapher Dhanashree Verma released a new song titled 'Dekha Ji Dekha Maine' on the same day she was granted a divorce from cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal.

Rahul Gandhi says caste census key to exposing India's inequality, BJP hits backResponding to Rahul Gandhi's outburst about India's education system not favouring the lower castes, the BJP said that the Congress leader crying foul about the country's merit-based education system reflects the party's 'dynastic' mindset.

Adolescence highlights 'growing problem', must screen in schools: UK Prime MinisterThe UK Prime Minister, Keir Starmer, backed the call for screening Netflix's show Adolescence in schools. The four-part show sheds light on the growing influence of social media on teenage boys.

Tulsi Gabbard's India visit highlights Trump-PM Modi bond: US spy chief's office'This visit highlights the decades-strong US-India relationship that is bolstered by the leadership of and friendship between Prime Minister Modi and President Donald Trump,' a statement from Tulsi Gabbard's office read.

Sudan Army recaptures presidential palace after two years of warThe Sudanese army said on Friday it took control of ministries in addition to the Presidential Palace in Khartoum, a significant milestone in a two-year-old war between the army and paramilitary group RSF, which threatens to fracture the country.

Milind Deora slams Mounjaro's launch, calls for higher sugar taxesRajya Sabha member Milind Deora has criticised the launch of Mounjaro in India. The weight-loss drug, developed by US-based Eli Lilly, is a weekly injectable medicine that costs Rs 3,500 for the 2.5 mg vial.

'Didn't I tell you…': Kerala man posts message after killing friend's husbandA man from Kerala's Kannur shot an auto driver dead at an under-construction house, posting threats on Facebook before and after the murder. His chilling messages hinted at his intentions well in advance.

Did you know that ICSE exam papers were checked in England until 1970s?ICSE exam papers were set and corrected in England until 1970, decades after independence. The shift to an Indian evaluation system marked a break from colonial control over education.

Karnataka BJP MLAs mistake finance bill for that of Muslim quota, tear copiesAmid uproar in the Karnataka Assembly over the honey trap scandal, the Congress tabled and passed a finance bill. However, BJP MLAs, believing it to be 4 per cent reservation for Muslims in government contracts bill, flung and tore its copies, disrupting the proceedings.

Fire at Delhi judge's bungalow leads to huge cash recovery; he gets transferredJustice Yashwant Verma was sent back to his parent court following the recommendation of the Supreme Court Collegium after the incident came to light.

'Dying with dignity' debate must balance care, choiceThe India Today Conclave 2025 brought together an eclectic mix of experts to discuss the legal, medical and spiritual aspects of an individual's right to die with dignity

Karnataka legislators' salary hike bill passed, Rs 10 crore extra cost to stateThe Karnataka Assembly passed a bill increasing the salaries of the Chief Minister, ministers and MLAs, increasing government spending by Rs 10 crore annually. The move came amid uproar over a honey trap scandal and BJP MLAs disrupting the proceedings.

Air India passenger found dead with seatbelt still fastened after flight landsThe Air India passenger had not unfastened his seatbelt, indicating that he had died midair. The exact cause of death will be ascertained after postmortem, police said.

Pakistan plans to legalise cryptocurrency to tackle economic slowdownNearly 15-20 million Pakistanis are already trading digital assets. Further, countries like the US and UAE are embracing crypto-friendly policies, making it crucial for Pakistan to stay competitive.

UPI services will be suspended on some mobile numbers from April 1. Details hereThe NPCI will start delinking UPI IDs linked to inactive mobile numbers from April 1, 2025, potentially disrupting digital payments for affected users. To avoid issues, ensure your bank records are updated with your current mobile number.

sports.headline: After Hasan Nawaz's hundred, fans want Babar Azam, Rizwan to retireNZ vs PAK: Fans reckoned that Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan should retire from T20Is after Hasan Nawaz's record century helped Pakistan beat New Zealand in Auckland.

Hasan Nawaz hits Pakistan's fastest T20I hundred in record run chase in AucklandNew Zealand vs Pakistan, 3rd T20I: Hasan Nawaz, 22, hit his hundred in just 44 deliveries in Auckland, breaking the record for the fastest hundred in T20Is for Pakistan. The visitors chased 205 in just 16 overs to keep the five-match series alive.

Shreya Ghoshal, Karan Ahuja and Disha Patani will perform in front of what is expected to be a packed crowd.

Not going to stress over India comeback during IPL 2025: Mohammed SirajIPL 2025: Mohammed Siraj said he will be fully focussed on giving his best for Gujarat Titans- his first new franchise after having spent seven years at RCB. Siraj was not picked for Champions Trophy 2025.

PCB says no monetary loss in Champions Trophy, claims USD 10 million profitPakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has refuted claims of monetary loss after hosting the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 and said that it earned approximately USD 10 million as profit.

India submits bid to host 2030 Commonwealth Games: Sports Ministry SourcesIndia submitted the bid to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games on Thursday, March 20. It's a major step towards achieving India's dream of hosting the 2036 Summer Olympic Games in Ahmedabad.

Injury-struck LSG hope for miracle from Rishabh Pant, Nicholas PooranLucknow Super Giants are set to usher in a new era under Rishabh Pant. But things could get very tricky for the squad due to the multiple deficiencies in the team.

The Warriors' injury report seems favourable as they prepare for an epic battle except Gary Payton II who is uncertain due to a knee injury.

NBA: Teyana Taylor accuses Iman Shumpert of leaking divorce detailsTeyana Taylor and Iman Shumpert finalised their divorce on June 27, 2024. However, Taylor has now taken legal action against Shumpert, accusing him of leaking sealed divorce documents to the media.

NBA: It just feels like home, says Luka Dončić on the Lakers after big win over NuggetsThe Los Angeles Lakers and Luka Dončić extended their winning streak with a 120-108 victory over the Denver Nuggets on Wednesday, March 19 in the NBA regular game at Crypto.com Arena.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
